author: Business
title: CAA Evacuates Headquarters Over Security Threat, Citing ‘Abundance of Caution’
text:
The Wrap CAA Evacuates Headquarters Over Security Threat, Citing ‘Abundance of Caution’ Raquel 'Rocky' Harris January 25, 2024 at 11:55 PM · 1 min read Link Copied Read full article
Creative Artists Agency (CAA) employees were forced to clear out of their headquarters building on Thursday following a security threat, according to reports.
Per an internal memo sent to staffers, Century City employees were told to “proceed home” while the threat was investigated. Law enforcement and security k-9s were at the scene.
“CAA Global Safety & Security has confirmed that the Los Angeles CAA offices have received a security threat,” the note sent to employees, who report to 2000 Avenue of the Stars building.
“You safety is our top priority. While the threat is being investigated for its credibility, out of an abundance of caution, ww are closing the Los Angeles offices,” the memo continued. “Please proceed home and encourage those who are able to utilize the stairs to do so as there may be congestions with the elevators.”
Employees have completely evacuated the building and there are no details about when staff members will be able to return.
The last time the agency experienced an evacuation was in 2020, which was the result of a suspected gas leak. Prior to that, in 2015, the building was evacuated after a suspicious package was found on the ninth floor of the building and was suspected be a bomb. The Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD) stated that there was no bomb, but the team did find an unknown liquid in the package.
The post CAA Evacuates Headquarters Over Security Threat, Citing ‘Abundance of Caution’ appeared first on TheWrap .

author: A.J. Mastrangelo
title: Local
text: {p}{strong}From Nick Russo, Storm Team 10 Meteorologist:{/strong}{/p}{p}Clear and cold tonight with lows in the upper 20s as winds ease up. The winds pick back up on Sunday, resulting in a high fire danger again. A Red Flag Warning is in effect from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. on Sunday across all of Southern New England. High temperatures Sunday will be a touch warmer in the upper 50s to near 60. Expect increasing clouds on Sunday ahead of an approaching area of low pressure which will bring light rain after sunset Sunday night. Not much rain is expected with that system, only around a quarter inch in most spots.{ }{/p}{p}Monday will be the warmest day of the week as sunshine returns and high temperatures reach the mid to upper 60s. It turns cooler starting Tuesday with highs back in the 50s. Wednesday and Thursday will be chilly as highs struggle to make it out of the 40s. Our next chance for a few light rain showers arrives Thursday afternoon.{/p}{p}{strong}Check the latest weather stories for Southern New England on the {a href=\"https://turnto10.com/weather/weather-blog\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://turnto10.com/weather/weather-blog\"}Storm Team 10 Weather Blog.{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}Tonight: Clear and cold. Low: 29{/p}{p}Sunday: Increasing clouds with light rain likely after sunset. High: 58{/p}{p}Monday: Early clouds, increasing sun, a bit milder. High: 67{/p}{p}Tuesday: Mostly sunny. High: 57{/p}{p}Wednesday: Mainly sunny. High: 48{/p}{p}Thursday: Mostly cloudy with a few showers possible later the day. High: 50{/p}{p}Friday: Mostly cloudy. Small risk of a shower. High: 52{/p}{p}Saturday: Mostly sunny.
